title: NFL Hall of Famer Troy Aikman appears unhappy with Patrick Mahomes comparison
text:
Hall of Fame quarterback Troy Aikman clapped back at an article drawing a comparison between his touchdown totals and the numbers of Kansas City Chiefs star Patrick Mahomes.

According to The Athletic, Mahomes has thrown 36 percent of Aikman’s career touchdowns in 20 games. Aikman played in 165 games in his 12 seasons with the Dallas Cowboys. He has 165 career touchdown passes while Mahomes has 60.

ROETHLISBERGER UNDERGOES ELBOW SURGERY, PLANS 2020 RETURN

Aikman didn’t appear to like The Athletic’s analysis.

“iCYMI: Talk to me when when he has 33% of my Super Bowl Titles,” he tweeted.

JAGS' RAMSEY MISSES PRACTICE WITH ILLNESS AMID TRADE DEMAND

Aikman was a three-time Super Bowl champion and won his first title in 1992 – his fourth season with the Cowboys. He also was playing with Hall of Famers Michael Irvin and Emmitt Smith during his career.

CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

Mahomes is in his third season with the Chiefs and managed to make it to the AFC Championship game in his second season. Mahomes may not be playing with any surefire Hall of Famers yet, but he does have one of the best tight ends in the league in Travis Kelce to throw to.
description: Hall of Fame quarterback Troy Aikman clapped back at an article drawing a comparison between his touchdown totals and the numbers of Kansas City Chiefs star Patrick Mahomes.
authors: Ryan Gaydos Is An Editor For Fox News. Follow Him On Twitter
